title: Artistic Style Specification
description: A schema for formally defining the characteristics of a visual artistic style.

style_name.description: The unique name identifying the artistic style.

description.description: A brief description of the artistic style and its purpose.

overall_aesthetic.description: Describes the general look and feel of the style.

summary.description: A concise summary of the style's core aesthetic characteristics.

impression.description: The overall feeling or message conveyed by the style.

visual_elements.description: Detailed breakdown of the core visual components and techniques.

perspective.description: Specification for the perspective or projection used.

type.description: The primary type of perspective (e.g., Isometric, Linear, Atmospheric).

details.description: Specific details about the perspective implementation.

effect.description: The intended visual or conceptual effect of the chosen perspective.

representation.description: How forms are depicted (e.g., '3D forms rendered using 2D line art').

technique.description: Specific techniques used to convey depth or volume.

clarity.description: How clarity of form and structure is maintained.

line_art.description: Specifications for the use of lines.

quality.description: The characteristic quality of the lines (e.g., Crisp, Sketchy, Rough).

weight.description: Details about line weight/thickness and its variation.

style.description: The style of lines used (e.g., Solid, Dashed, Dotted, Stylized).

continuity.description: Whether lines are typically continuous or broken.

scheme.description: The overall color approach (e.g., Monochrome, Analogous, Complementary, Custom).

variants.description: Specific examples or descriptions of allowed color combinations.

contrast.description: The typical level of contrast within the palette.

shading_and_texture.description: How shading, gradients, and surface textures are handled.

shading.description: Presence and style of shading (e.g., Absent, Cel-shading, Smooth Gradients).

texture.description: Presence and style of surface textures (e.g., None, Subtle Noise, Material-specific).

exceptions.description: Any permitted exceptions or specific techniques (e.g., Minimal hatching).

composition.description: Principles guiding the arrangement of elements.

spacing.description: How space is used between elements.

negative_space.description: The role and treatment of negative space.

balance.description: The typical approach to compositional balance (e.g., Symmetrical, Asymmetrical, Radial).

geometry_and_form.description: How geometric shapes and forms are treated.

simplification.description: The degree to which forms are simplified or abstracted.

edges_and_corners.description: The characteristic treatment of edges and corners (e.g., Sharp, Rounded, Beveled).

consistency.description: Requirements for consistency in geometric treatment.

level.description: General level of detail (e.g., Minimalist, Moderate, Photorealistic).

focus.description: What aspects are emphasized (e.g., Overall shape, Surface texture, Internal mechanics).

symbolism.description: How symbols or iconic elements are integrated, if applicable.

intended_feel.description: Keywords describing the emotional or intellectual response the style aims to evoke.

potential_use_cases.description: Examples of where this style might be effectively applied.
